intro: Discocapnos mundii var. dregei, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
